column4: HELP - does anybody know how to start SKYPE as AWAY (automatically)?
timing out is not good enough?
you can go to Tools-Options and set the time until it shows you as "Away".
thanx, but somehow it does not work...
it waits until you are inactive (ie. not using the mouse and keyboard)
well, I wanted something that did not need me off the computer... thanx anyway
it's something you can ask Skype support.
u r write only it does not appear in their manual/FAQ/google... (as far as I tried)
first, unplug the drive if it is pluggable.
you may be able to undelete files from DOS/Windows.
how is that done (I am using a dual-boot with XP) haven't rebooted since the deletion (of about 15G)
was XP on the partition you deleted?
no, XP is on a third partition (NTFS), the one deleted using rm is a FAT32 (used for archives) and I have a linux partition which is ext3 I belive (Dapper)

deleting in fat filesystems works by removing the first two bytes from the filename in the fat (file allocation table) entry. So there is a chance to recover. I don't know about any linux utilities that do this though.
is there a way ,after deleting using linux, to recover using XP?
earlier versions of Windows had an undelete utility. I don't know about XP. You can probably mount your XP partition and search for a file with undel in the name.
sbassett516, is it for linux or XP, is it free, how is it used, is it safe to reboot without risking loosing the deleted file? (sorry for the loads of Qs)
you can probably find the kind of tool you need on the ultimate boot cd (http://www.ultimatebootcd.com/)
